kmjosey wrote:
> What I ended up doing was creating a string buffer, and with each
> failure I added the url and the error message with a control n at the
> end. And I asserted on whether the string was empty and if not it
> outputed the string with assertEquals(message, object, objectToCompare)

This is the same as creating a List and adding each url/error message to 
the List as you go. Then:

     assertEquals(Collections.EMPTY_LIST, failedUrls);

If there are failed URLs, you'll see a list of them.
